The first victims of flight 655 were buried in Iran at funeral services that became bitter anti-American demonstrations. Mourners waved their fists, shouting ''Death to America!'' and ''Down with Reagan!'' A1

Ties with North Korea are being improved, Seoul announced. President Roh Tae Woo said South Korea would welcome trade, family visits and student exchanges with the North and would spur other countries to improve links. A1
A Japanese stock sale scandal erupted. The beneficiaries were said to include many leading politicians, including an aide to Prime Minister Noboru Takeshita. A3

Millions of Mexicans voted in the most hotly contested elections in nearly half a century. The expected winner of the presidential vote is Carlos Salinas de Gortari, whose party has been victorious since 1929. A9
A Soviet astronaut will be on Mars by the year 2010, according to Roald Z. Sagdeyev, the Soviet Union's top civilian space scientist. A15
2 top Chinese leaders cite unrest growing out of restructuring A2
U.N.-linked aviation agency to consider an Airbus inquiry A11

NATIONAL A12-20 Sixty days' notice would have to be given by companies before closing factories or ordering large-scale layoffs under a bill approved, 72-23, by the Senate. The huge margin may be enough to override an expected veto. A1

The price of Union Carbide shares was manipulated in 1986 by the GAF Corporation, its vice chairman and two subsidiaries after they tried unsuccessfully to take over Union Carbide, a grand jury indictment charged. A1

A plan to trade away oil rights in the Arctic National Wildlife Refuge being pressed by the Reagan Administration is not in the public interest and should be abandoned, a Congressional study says. A13

The Dust Bowl era of the 1930's has become the standard to which the drought of 1988 is being likened by tens of thousands of ranchers and farmers across the northern Great Plains, the Middle West and the South. A14
A successor to Edwin Meese 3d as Attorney General will be nominated quickly, the White House said, even though the Administration has only six more months in office. A12
Sleepers prone to violence are benefiting from new clinics and drugs. A Minneapolis group has studied more than 100 people plagued by abnormal experiences in sleep. B7
The Pentagon procurement inquiry involves mounds of confiscated documents, but since nearly all of them are sealed, there is no firm information on the extent of any fraud or bribery. A1
Lack of young tarpon off Florida Is a Mystery A12 New AIDS test made available commercially A17
POLITICS A18 Michael S. Dukakis is deciding his choice of a running mate 12 days before the opening of the Democratic National Convention, but he is giving few clues about his selection. A18
Governor Dukakis, attacking the ethical standards of the Administration, said the resignation of Attorney General Meese had given the nation ''a measure of self-respect.'' A18
A Hispanic in a Bush Cabinet was pledged by the Vice President. Mr. Bush's promise was hailed at a Dallas convention of the nation's largest and oldest Hispanic civic organization. A18

Jesse Jackson assailed George Bush, accusing the Vice President of showing ''bad taste'' and being ''downright vulgar'' in praising American Naval officers who shot down an Iranian jetliner, killing 290 civilians. A18

Reagan remark stirs debate on gun control REGIONAL B1-5 Long Island beaches were closed along a 15-mile stretch when a wave of sewage, syringes, blood vials and bags of infectious hospital waste washed ashore. The closed areas included Jones Beach and Robert Moses State Parks. A1

Many lakes are so acidic in the Adirondack Mountains that they can no longer support fish, a three-year study by New York State has found. Officials said acid rain was the major cause of the problem. A1
Thousands of herring have died in creeks and riverbeds of the northeast Bronx in recent days. Environmental officials said such kills would likely also occur in western parts of Long Island Sound. B4

Higher Jersey auto insurance costs averaging 13.1 percent must be paid by 2.2 million of the state's 4 million motorists, Trenton announced four days after legislators failed to agree on bills to reduce the premiums. B2

Amtrak will bypass Grand Central and consolidate all its Manhattan operations at Pennsylvania Station by 1990, the passenger rail system announced, saying it would build a 10-mile track extension to carry out the change. B1

A man pleaded guilty to murdering a crime witness and gave a chilling account of how he and another man executed 61-year-old Mildred Greene. The confession was made by Wadell Winston, 27, of Queens. B3

A Howard Beach victim erupted on the witness stand at the second trial in the racial attack case, spitting, cursing and refusing to testify further after a defense lawyer asked him a sarcastic question. B3
